prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 4C-02.19 z_abs=2.04 I
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This science goal aims to trace the following transitions (rest frame GHz): H2O2(268.9612) CH3SH(269.1472) CH3SH(269.2046) CH3SH(299.4857) CH3OH(303.3669) CH3OH(304.2083) CH3OH(307.1659) H3O+(307.1924)

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The TDM spectral resolution is expected to be too coarse for the goals of this proposal, so the correlator set-up is chosen so that the spectral resolution samples well the target absorption lines. We assume a line FWHM of 50km/s based on the observations toward PKS1830-211 (Muller et al. 2014).

For the scope of this proposal, the source is not required to be spatially resolved since the fluxes considered for the sensitivity computation come from a facility with much coarser spatial resolution, even though the source appears point-like down to WISE resolution. Hence, a compact configurations is suitable for these observations.

Based on the line-to-continuum ratios observed toward PKS 1830-211 (Muller et al. 2014), we find that requesting sensitivities at the 1% level of the continuum level is a proper value to consider. The adopted continuum level is the 1sigma lower limit of the observed continuum flux. The lowest Planck DR2 flux reported at 100GHz (between detFlux, psfFlux, and gauFlux) is 966+-46mJy, where the 1sigma lower limit is around 900mJy, hence the requested sensitivity is 9mJy.
No flux correction is applied as a result from distinct spatial resolution between Planck and ALMA, since the source is observed to be point-like down to WISE resolutions, not much different from those requested by the proposal.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: QSO_B2126-15 z_abs=2.638 I
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This science goal aims to trace the following transitions (rest frame GHz): CH3SH(343.5728) CH3SH(345.0210) CH3SH(350.0037) H3O+(388.4586) CH3SH(392.3189) CH3SH(395.4883) H3O+(396.2724)

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The TDM spectral resolution is expected to be too coarse for the goals of this proposal, so the correlator set-up is chosen so that the spectral resolution samples well the target absorption lines. We assume a line FWHM of 50km/s based on the observations toward PKS1830-211 (Muller et al. 2014).

For the scope of this proposal, the source is not required to be spatially resolved since the fluxes considered for the sensitivity computation come from a facility with much coarser spatial resolution, even though the source appears point-like down to WISE resolution. Hence, a compact configurations is suitable for these observations.

Based on the line-to-continuum ratios observed toward PKS 1830-211 (Muller et al. 2014), we find that requesting sensitivities at the 1% level of the continuum level is a proper value to consider. The adopted continuum level is the 1sigma lower limit of the observed continuum flux. The flux estimate reported at 90GHz by Steppe et al.(1995) is 294+-18mJy, where the 1sigma lower limit is around 270mJy, hence the requested sensitivity is 2.7mJy.
No flux correction is applied as a result from distinct spatial resolution between IRAM-30m and ALMA, since the source is observed to be point-like down to WISE resolutions, not much different from those requested by the proposal.

Resolving the indicated lines(s) is essential for this science case.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Testing the universality of physical laws is one the most profound scientific measurements. ALMA allows us to do this through precision spectroscopy tests of the stability of Nature's fundamental couplings: detections of any variations would be direct proof of new physics beyond current paradigms, but even improved null results will constrain a substantial range of extensions to the standard model. The proton-to-electron mass ratio is a measure of the interplay between the electroweak and strong sectors of particle physics. In the optical/UV band it can be measured directly in the range 2<z<4, while in the radio/mm band, direct measurements of the proton-to-electron mass ratio have only been published for two lines of sight at z>1 even though the millimetre range provides much higher precision given the spectral resolution of current facilities operating at these wavelengths and the existence of molecular species, emiting/absorbing in this spectral range, much more sensitive to such variations. The proposal aims to significantly increase the number and redshift range of available targets with which to test the stability of the proton-to-electron mass ratio in the mm spectral range.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Centre for astrophysics , Porto, University of
